title: Using Shapely package with feedforward keras neural network

labels.name: awaiting feedback
labels.description: Indicates that further information is required from the issue creator

body:
I'm making a keras model and trying to use Shapley values to analyze the weightage of the different input features (there are 1598 of them total). The code is copied here: 
```
from tensorflow.keras.layers import Dropout
from tensorflow.keras import layers
from tensorflow.keras import regularizers
from tensorflow.keras import constraints
from tensorflow.keras.layers import InputLayer

filename = os.path.join(mod_path, 'CL_MOD_ANN.regulizer_all=l2,input,valid_split = 0.15,kernel intializer,batchnorm moved,small,activation=elu,relu,constraint-->last, lr=0.00005,dropout=0.05-->moved,epoch = 30.h5')

if mod_check(filename):
    print('WARNING: Load from the existing model.')
    mod_ann = keras.models.load_model(filename)
else:
    constraint = tf.keras.constraints.MinMaxNorm(min_value=-5, 
                                                 max_value=5, 
                                                 rate=1.0, axis=0)
    mod_ann = keras.models.Sequential([
        InputLayer(input_shape=(1599, )),
        keras.layers.Dense(300, 
                           activation='elu', 
                           kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform'),
        keras.layers.Dense(200,
                           activation='relu',
                           kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform',
                           kernel_regularizer='l2'), 
        Dropout(0.05),
        keras.layers.BatchNormalization(),
        keras.layers.Dense(100, 
                           activation='relu',
                           kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform',
                           kernel_regularizer='l2'), 
        keras.layers.Dense(80,
                           activation='relu',
                           kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform',
                           kernel_regularizer='l2'),
        keras.layers.Dense(50, 
                           activation='relu',
                           kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform',
                           kernel_constraint = constraint,
                           kernel_regularizer='l2'),
    ])
    
    
    mod_ann.add(keras.layers.Dense(1, activation='sigmoid', kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform'))
    
    run_logdir = get_run_logdir()
    
    checkpoint_cb = keras.callbacks.ModelCheckpoint(filename, save_best_only=True)
    
    logger_cb = keras.callbacks.CSVLogger(filename + '.log', separator=',', append=False)

    mod_ann.compile(optimizer=keras.optimizers.Nadam(lr=0.00005, beta_1 = 0.995, beta_2 = 0.999),
                    loss='binary_crossentropy',
                    metrics=['accuracy'])
    mod_ann.fit(X_train_std, y_train, epochs= 30, shuffle='true', 
                validation_split=0.15,
                callbacks=[checkpoint_cb,logger_cb])
```
Its a very energy intensive model since it is interpreting over 100,000 images. When I try to get the input features/shapely values for them my ram on google collar just can't hold it all and I have a runtime error. The model works with an xgb boost but not with neural network. 

My code to get Shapley values is simply this: 
```
explainer = shap.Explainer(mod_ann.predict, X)
batch_size = 16
shap_values = explainer(X, batch_size=batch_size, max_evals=3199)
```
Anyone have a suggestion?
